p: Residual systemic inflammatory and procoagulant activity can be observed in survivors of hospitalization for pneumonia long after resolution of the index infection [ 56]. Nevertheless, long-term follow-up data concerning the survivors of respiratory virus epidemics are scarce. An observational study previously demonstrated that hospitalization for pneumonia was associated with increased short-term and long-term risk of CVD, suggesting that pneumonia may be an important risk factor for CVD [ 110]. In order to increase our understanding, serial follow-up studies amongst the survivors of COVID-19 are sorely needed.
